arm_group.description: Training civil servants in Medellin (Colombia) on attention to violence against women.

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to determine whether the training of civil servants   leads to
      a reduction in the violence suffered by women, as well as in their psychological wellbeing
      and attitudes towards violence.

clinical_study.brief_title: Impact Evaluation of Training Civil Servants on Violence Against Women in Medellín, Colombia

detailed_description.textblock:
The Secretary of Women of Medellin, through the ICONTEC, intends to conduct training to
      officials of the 22 family commissioners in Medellin. The objective of these trainings is to
      standardize procedures in order that women do not feel re-victimized and can forward
      complaints. Since the training will be done in phases in 2014 and there is willingness of
      relevant stakeholders to generate a random order on which commissioners the training is
      first performed, it can be done a cluster randomized trial.

      We will require all 22 commissioners to be randomly assigned into two groups, one treatment
      and one control. To implement it is intended to:

        -  Conduct a baseline survey amongst women who used the services of the commissionaires
           between June and Septmber 2013, completed the process of care and signed informed
           consent.

        -  Training of a randomly chosen set of 11 commissioners will take place between June and
           September 2014.

        -  Conduct an endline survey amongst women who used the services of any of the 22
           commissionaires between June and September 2014, completed the process of care and
           signed informed consent.

      Women will be contacted through the commissioners. Women who have completed the process of
      care will be ask whether they want to participate in the study. If they agree, their contact
      details will transfer to the investigators for the survey to be conducted.  This process
      would be conducted twice for baseline information before beginning the training, and for
      endline, once half of the first 11 commissioners have been trained.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Women who initiate and finalize the process with the comissaries of family

intervention.description: The Secretary of Women of Medellin, through the ICONTEC, intends to conduct training to officials of the 22 family commissioners in Medellin. The objective of these trainings is to standardize procedures in order that women do not feel re-victimized and can forward complaints.
intervention.intervention_name: Training civil servants on attention to violence against women

clinical_study.official_title: Capacity of State and Local Actors to Respond to Violence Against Women: Impact Evaluation of Training Civil Servants on Violence Against Women in Medellín (Colombia), Component of the Program "Seguridad Pública"

oversight_info.authority: Colombia: Ethics Institutional Committee for Research

primary_outcome.description: The outcome will be measure through a survey to women who used the services of the commissionaires, completed the process of care and signed informed consent

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: The outcome will be measure through a survey to women who used the services of the commissionaires, completed the process of care and signed informed consent
secondary_outcome.measure: Knowledge, attitudes and practices (KAP) on violence and care pathways
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Average of 8 months after the complaint was presented at the comissaries

secondary_outcome.description: The outcome will be measure through a survey to women who used the services of the commissionaires, completed the process of care and signed informed consent
secondary_outcome.measure: Psychological well-being (self-acceptance, positive relationships, autonomy, environmental mastery, personal growth, purpose in life)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Average of 8 months after the complaint was presented at the comissaries

secondary_outcome.description: The outcome will be measured through secondary data of the commissaries with information between the time of the initiation of the complaint and the completed the process of care.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Average of 8 months after the complaint was presented at the comissaries

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Subject), Primary Purpose: Treatment
